website_summaries.verdict: Towed behind a riding mower, this wide aerator that can tackle most lawn maintenance relatively quickly. Assembly can be a hassle, though.
pros: At 48 inches wide, aerator covers lots of ground in one pass
Works well in most moderately watered soils
Responsive customer service and warranty parts replacement
cons: Assembly can be a bit complicated, taking 2 to 4 hours
Plug depth varies depending on soil condition and how much weight is placed on aerator

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: What a nightmare. I have never had any product that required so much time building it! After reading the reviews I took a chance hoping that all my parts were in the box.....they are not! 4 bolts and 4 nuts missing. Had to go to the hardware store. After 2.5 hours I was finished. Hooked it up to my lawn mower put down the blades and 20 feet later the left wheel fell off! Bad weld on the wheel support! Others have had the same problem. Also had snapped the head off of two of the bolts....poor quality! Will return tomorrow and find another manufacturer that makes a product that will last more that 2 minute!! Fo not purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: RAS

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t make it 7 months
customer_reviews.text: I am highly disappointed with this lawn aerator. I bought this one to replace my tractor supply aerator that I bought over eight years ago and this one did not make it seven months. As you can see in the photos there must’ve been a hairline crack in the towbar because of the rust that is in the tool bar where the split happen and you can see the fresh metal on the other side. Since I am writing this one star review the handle that lifts the aerator tines off the ground, that also failed.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Ryder

customer_reviews.title: Works but Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Got this a few weeks ago and worked like a charm. Assembly is tedious. Unfortunately after a couple hours use, the tow bar bent and lost all integrity. Replaced it with an aluminum square tube. Works great. But that bar should be much more sturdy. Overall this is a good aerator, just don’t overload the tray (175lbs) and don’t back-up with it. Will ruin the tow bar for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Polish Dog

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Worked like a charm. Beats renting a push behind at $75
customer_reviews.text: 100lb box, but packaged like the manufacturer actually cared. I used a pneumatic ratchet to assemble, but it still took me almost two hours. WEAR GLOVES and a pair of old jeans. Knives sharp! Lay all the parts out and inventory. Nothing missing in mine. Excellent well written instructions. But the figure at Step 11 could have been better. Customer support line available. I used old recycle bins half full of gravel and tied down for extra weight. Worked great! Looks like a 1000 chihuahua’s used my grass for a few days. Well done and US made.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis L. Cardwell

customer_reviews.title: Met my needs
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in my high clay content yard. I added two bags of sand and 16 bricks to do my backyard. Used the sand to refill my kids sandbox then did my front yard with just the bricks. Could have used a little more weight but still worked. My only complaint is the handle: I can not reach it from the tractor seat when it’s in the lowered position. When doing the front yard and having to cross the driveway and front walkway, I tied a short rope onto the handle so I could raise and lower as needed without having to stop multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: E.N.

customer_reviews.title: Junk junk junk!
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk. You have to put every single part together and the directions are vague. You can watch videos of assembly and everyone has issues. All the bits and bolts are thrown into a bag and you’re left to separate each piece and figure it out. I’m very crafty and put many things together but nothing aggravated me more than this junk. Even assembled, Ive used better aerators. I get this will have dents and dings but the box was destroyed when I received it and had many cut places as well as large dents. Something out of the box shouldn’t be in such bad shape.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: BEAUTIFULLY ENGINEERED
customer_reviews.text: I say beautifully engineered and I mean it. Well designed, well built, heavy machined parts, precision holes and connectors. I knew as I put it together that any machine this well designed and built had to perform well and it did not disappoint me. Plan on a couple of hours assembly and you really need good socket wrenches. I bought this, a de-thatcher and a grass broadcaster all by Agri-Fab and they were all excellent. Including the price of these three items and grass seed, the fall seeding and aeration for my yard was still five hundred dollars less that my lawn service would have charged me for doing it ONCE!
customer_reviews.author: Dicky

customer_reviews.title: Broke on second use. Dangerous. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in August of 2018. Was aerating my yard today and the tongue of the aerator folded in half nearly throwing me off my lawn mower. I had two 40lb sand bags on the deck. This is not much weight. Upon closer inspection the c-channel tongue is made from extremely light gauge steel. Surely a company like agri-fab can do better than this and make an aerator which will last more than two uses on a 12k sq ft residential lawn. Luckily this didn’t happen on a hill or the results could have been really bad. I don’t know what other aerator to tell you to purchase but this unit is junk. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with packaging fully in-tact. Wore gloves but it still bit me a few times and drew blood once. Directions were pretty good but we're not clear on which side the "short end" and "long end" of the axle should be in relation to the left or right side. Ended up assembling and disassembling a few time while the machine kept trying to bite me. Did a decent job on the lawn. I used 3 concrete blocks, probably should use 4. Got maybe 1 inch plugs, expected 2-3 inch plugs. Overall, a good value for the money considering TruGreen wanted $350 to aerate my lawn once. Materials are very solid so it should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jim L - Tallahassee FL

customer_reviews.title: Very very very very hard to put together but a great product
customer_reviews.text: This is great product works very good happy with it. With that being said when you start to put this together the instructions are very vague this is a project for someone who is very experienced with mechanical it is very very hard to put together if you can find a video on it I would if you can find a retailer to put it together it would be best has very sharp edges I had Cuts all over from putting this together do not try this on your own if you do not have someone to put this together do not buy but once it is together it is a great product
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Self

customer_reviews.title: Great aerator.
customer_reviews.text: Well designed product that does exactly what it's supposed to. Worked great on my acre of hard Kansas compacted clay. Tip: I watered every zone of grass for an extended period the day before. I wanted 3" cores and easily got them after applying water. Fair warning: long sleeves with thick, durable material and gloves required for assembly. When I finished assembling mine I looked like I had tangled with a very unhappy Bobcat.
customer_reviews.author: Keenan B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product at a reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: Delivered promptly after ordering on-line. A couple of parts were missing, but Agri-Fab customer service was courteous and quick to correct the issue. I had the missing parts delivered in a few days. The instructions were good and assembly took about 2.5 hours to complete (I'm meticulous). I used the aerator the following day after a rain and it worked GREAT! It pulled anywhere from 1" to 2" plugs depending on how hard my soil was with 130 Lbs. of cement block loaded on the tray. Overall, I'm very pleased with the aerator's price, quality and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Parts missing, assembly time long not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to buy one these machines get one already assembled if possible. Like other reviews, I was short some parts in this case carriage bolts. The assembly instruction although decent compared to the Chinese electronic crap you buy its not too bad. However, I needed to down load the PDF so I can enlarge the views to figure out how to this thing goes together...Way to many nuts and bolts of different sizes, would have nice if they figured out a way to limit the variety needed for assembly and provided some enlarged views to detail the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Fuchs

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't too hard to put together, just follow directions and be careful of the sharp tines. Worked great for me, I used day after a small rain and put 4 concrete blocks on it for extra weight and it pulled out plugs about 1 1/2 inches long. My yard had never been aerated and it really needed it and really helped for water getting to the roots
customer_reviews.author: D Long

customer_reviews.title: Completely unassembled
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting that this unit would be partially assembled. That was wrong. Every piece needs to be assembled. It took me several hours to complete. The positive of that is that any piece could be replaced. This is a heavy gauge, solid piece of equipment. Be careful because I had blood all over my hands during assembly from the sharp edges. Additionally, I had a lot of left over hardware and I had to go to the hardware store to buy 5 missing lag bolts and nuts. I must have received the wrong hardware packs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This Core aerator is exactly what I needed. I was sick of renting a machine twice a year because of my two different types of grasses. In the summer for my summer grasses and in the fall for my cool season grasses. I would suggest that you make sure and have enough sandbags or cinderblocks to add weight to it. Didn’t take as long as some reviews have mentioned! I’m also happy that you can buy the “blades” locally when they are damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and its made in the USA!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is solid from top to bottom. Was able to do my small yard, grass coverage less than an acre. This thing will last the rest of my life and is able to fit on the side of my garage. It actually pulls plugs and doesn't just punch holes in the ground. Definitely nice having this whenever I need it. Thumbs up all the way!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lou Bitgood

customer_reviews.title: It works really well
customer_reviews.text: You need to be really careful putting this together. It is sharp, dangerous and moderate difficulty for one person. 2-3 hours of time after you lay out the parts, watch videos and read instructions. After you do this you will be pleased to find that it works really well with weights applied to the back. I used sand bags, secured with paracord . You will need a safe place to store it....lots of sharp edges and dangerous for kids. It saved me many $$$ off bids to aerate my lawn. This is not a few beer project. Stay sharp and safe!....
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Decent aerator
customer_reviews.text: If you would like a decent tool that will get the job done but may not last super long go ahead and purchase this. If you have harder soil or are looking for something that will last for years get a different product. I've attached a picture of what the hitch looked like after using it once on my lawn.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Full Assembly Required
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. No issues with shipping/packaging. Some missing nuts & bolts type assembly hardware. The major pieces were all present. This aerator is a good product for the cost but you will be putting it together. Notable that it was not at all clear up front that full assembly was required, not just some assembly. This was a full assembly project. Be sure you're prepared for this task.
customer_reviews.author: Torqwrench

customer_reviews.title: JUNK---MANY PARTS MISSING.
customer_reviews.text: ITEM ARRIVED TODAY. BEFORE ASSEMBLY I INVENTORIED ALL OF THE PARTS. AlL OF THE LARGE PARTS WERE THERE, BUT 50% OF THE NUTS, BOLTS, WASHERS AND SCREWS WERE MISSING. AGRI-FAB HAS ZERO QUALITY CONTROL. THIS ITEM IS HEADING BACK TO AMAZON. AMAZON SHOULD STOP CARRYING THIS PIECE OF GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: WORST EVER EXPERIENCE
customer_reviews.text: Just Horrendous Experience! After 3+ hours trying to put this together and a lot of aggravation due to TERRIBLE instructions & missing parts the lever that is supposed to roll this does not. I am a craftsman by nature and assembled anything I ever purchased without any issues, this however was truly the worst ever. I would not recommend unless you want to risking cutting your fingers to put together a non-working bulky useless part. In between just throwing away vs. returning (Not sure if $ 200 is worth my time taking this apart again..)
customer_reviews.author: Heiko F.

customer_reviews.title: Built well and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Was a lot of work to assemble, but there years later and it is still in great shape. Store it outside under a tarp and looks like new. Use on over an acre of hilly land with a couple of heavy blocks is on the back. I would buy this again. I don't treat it gentle , but I do keep it clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kenmbz

customer_reviews.title: It's a beast to Virginia's compacted clay
customer_reviews.text: Bought, assembled and used this in Fall of 2019. Here in Spring 2020, I'm very happy with the results. I had a significant area in my suburban backyard with absolutely no growth due to the dense compacted clay we have. Thanks to this beast, I have grass growing in areas that were totally barren last year and deeper, more plush areas where I had spotty growth. My lawn has a ways to go still, but this aerator gave me much better results in this clay than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: NoVA Reader

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Worst product ever purchased. First time using it, broke after 90 minutes. Contacting the seller for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Marie Cerabona

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts, otherwise...
customer_reviews.text: The aerator is well made and works as advertised BUT shipped without all necessary hardware. Given how much you pay for the product, that’s unacceptable. I wish you better luck than I had finding a 1/4 x 1 3/4 hex bolt. Had to buy something larger and improvise because I didn’t feel like waiting to deal with Agri-fab customer service before completing assembly and putting it to use. Otherwise, would have given it a better review.
customer_reviews.author: M.K.

customer_reviews.title: Very bad
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in an open box. It is missing all hardware to put it together. There are NO blades and brackets among others. To many parts missing. I bought a new item, not a waste my time item trying to track down parts. No thank you. RETURNING due to lack of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Noah E

customer_reviews.title: Not a perfect design, but it works.
customer_reviews.text: On other aerators, the "blades" are a little offset from the shaft so they'll dig in straight while allowing your tractor or mower to move. With them squared up to the shaft like they are on this, it acts like a brake and smaller mowers will get bogged down. It'll pull maybe a 0.75-1.5" plug out of dry or compact soil with 150lbs of bricks on it. Wet soil has given me up to about a 2" plug - not as good as a dedicated aerator, but it's much MUCH easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Joel M Holland

customer_reviews.title: Works but you will work for it
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy as expected but installation is not for the meek. Expect ambiguous directions and bags that are conveniently unmarked ("A", "B", "C") . Took me about 1.5 hours and needed second person to help install the top cover and align everything perfectly. Still havent figured out how to get the wheels on correctly. I aerated my yard behind my Troy Bilt Super Bronco, weighed down with a cinder block, and 3-5 gallon filled gas cans. Worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: B. BAUER

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2.5 Acre Yard (or bigger)
customer_reviews.text: Great for the DIYer with a big yard - 48inch width is big but still manageable. I was able to go pretty quick without tearing up the yard. I used max weight (4x35lb=140lbs) and it was deep enough for our sandy soil. Hard clay you’d want to irrigate or wait until after a good rain. Mark your sprinkler heads with flags - this will crush ‘em. Heavy duty construction, but plan for a couple hours to put it together and a 90 lb box.
customer_reviews.author: B Media

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Was absolutely not was I was expecting for the price. I have used cheaper ones and had better results. The spikes did not penetrate and plug the ground as expected. It it wasn’t such a hassle to tear apart I would have sent back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts Difficult to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Cant tell how well it works. Terrible Instructions for complex assembly.They say there is video instructions but its just promo video. Well over hundreds of different small parts not labeled, just in plastic bag and two critical ones missing After 2 hours of frustration, gave up and will buy needed parts at hardware store. Too big to return and difficult to return or I would.
customer_reviews.author: GoGun USA

customer_reviews.title: Must have lawn equipent
customer_reviews.text: Well made, as sturdy as it needs to be. Assembly is kind of a pain but worth it as it works extremely well. VERY sharp and pulls out 2-3 inch plugs consistently.
customer_reviews.author: DClos

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I spent the extra few dollars to make this ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I spent the extra few dollars to make this purchase. Built sturdy and has the galvinized steel aerator spikes. One thing I have a problem with is the cheap " plastic split bearing". This bearing is inserted in each end of the spool assembly and rides on the axle. I doubt if they will last long. Besides that, everything else is good. Claims to made in the USA and every time I can help keep an American employed is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: JohnEvanBill

customer_reviews.title: Pretty weak
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, they shorted me parts. I didn’t bother contacting them, I just made it happen. It didn’t work great for me, despite having a lot of weight on it. 150 pounds at least. I would say it’s a must to have the lawn be really wet for it to work. My problem there is I’m using a tractor. Not a lawn tractor but an actual tractor to tow it. If my lawn is wet, the tractor will damage the lawn noticeably. In retrospect I would have purchased the Northern Tool 3 point hitch mounted unit for a couple hundred more.
customer_reviews.author: wrb752

customer_reviews.title: No complete.
customer_reviews.text: Box showed up in rough shape, it had no hardware, only one wheel, no aerator blades. Not happy at all, my day is completely wasted now having to box it up and ship it back.
customer_reviews.author: roger wilson

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: As I assembled this I was made aware of one thing. I'll never wear it out! This is a heavy duty item that will last a homeowner forever. The paint is quality, the parts are all heavy duty and it's made in the USA. Since adding this I have bought their thatcher as well and I also own one of their pull behind spreaders. They've all been top rate!
customer_reviews.author: S. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality. Welds on the wheel mount left side ...
customer_reviews.text: Poor Quality. Welds on the wheel mount left side where not finished causing the wheel to break off after less than an hour of use. From the photo you can see that there is only a tack weld on the mount. The Right side wheel mount was welded correctly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer D Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Granted, this is pretty sturdy for the money and does a good job but one star beacuse of this: a hole in the shaft was drilled at the wrong angle so the unit would not raise to the proper height and the spoons touched the ground when they were not supposed to. The factory was aware of this problem when I called them and they sent me a new shaft - took 2 weeks to get and the problem of having to spend anoither 2 hours to take it apart and put it together again. Bad quility control - the defective units should have been recalled, rather than have customers go through this hassle!.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product works well
customer_reviews.text: Used this on an acre of land. Used about 200 lbs. of weight on it to get the correct depth of plugs. If the ground if softer not as much weight is needed. Easy to assemble. Directions are fairly clear on how to assemble. Came with all the hardware needed for assembly. The plug knives are sharp so be careful during assembly and handling.
customer_reviews.author: adam wiljer

customer_reviews.title: Decent home aerator
customer_reviews.text: First time out with the aerator I find that the wheel bracket is bent so it doesn't roll very well. Not sure if it happened during aeration or came this way and didn't notice until now. Other than that it seems to do a decent job though plugs aren't that deep.
customer_reviews.author: J!

customer_reviews.title: Went together nicely, great support
customer_reviews.text: Just received it yesterday and put it together. I followed the directions carefully and they were well written. Everything went together nicely. There are a lot of bolts so it took about 2 hours but it was not difficult. Seems like a nice unit. Looking forward to using it this weekend. And it is made in the USA! had it for a year or so and the tow arm (tongue) broke. I contacted the vendor. Within a couple minutes after I got them the info they had a tracking number of the part they are sending out to me. WOW that is customer service. This is the way all customer support should be done. Thanks Vicki. !!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen M. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised, but be prepared to spend a while assembling it..
customer_reviews.text: Does the job - but it took me 2 hours to assemble it, and that was with an impact driver. If you plan to do this and use regular non-ratcheting wrenches, plan for 3-4 hours..
customer_reviews.author: J. Dubois

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts, box open and falling apart.
customer_reviews.text: My aerator arrived on Friday, I was not home. The UPS driver left me a note saying he wanted me to see this before he left. The box looked as if it had been in a warehouse for years and dropped many times. The box was destroyed, open and smashed on both ends parts were falling out. I didn't even bother to open and see the damage and missing parts. I am returning via UPS pick up and will not attempt to reorder. Very poor!
customer_reviews.author: kid@heart

customer_reviews.title: This aerator works great !
customer_reviews.text: At first I was a little hesitant about buying because of the weight. Read a lot of reviews about the damages. Was delivered in good shape by UPS. It took a couple of hours to assemble. Tried it out today. It was pulling 3 to 3.5 inch plugs out. Very impressed with this . Highly recommend buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: there are a few issues
customer_reviews.text: the tongue is really short, so if you need to back up at all, it's a little tricky, and if you wanted to pull it with something higher or lower than the standard lawn tractor receiver, it's a balancing act. Also the lever that keeps the wheels engaged is prone to popping out and dropping the spikes. You also have to put an inordinate amount of weight on it to get it to poke into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, broke within two hours of first use
customer_reviews.text: On the first day I used this unit, it broke under normal use and is now useless. The wheel bent off to the side, the tow tongue bent and the frame twisted to the point that I am unable to disengage the tines. I used four 8x8x16 concrete blocks as weight, as I have read others have done the same. I aerated my front acre fine, and had to quit halfway through my back acre due to the failure of the unit. Very disappointed as I had high hopes for the product.
customer_reviews.author: JJSIV

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly worked better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about ordering given all the reviews about missing parts and damaged packaging. My shipment came without damage, all the parts, easy to follow assembly instructions. Everything fit and the nylon washers where easy to install with a socket wrench. I did assembly without gloves and did not cut myself once. I started using 3 40 lbs bags of sand but removed 1 when it was getting too deep. The knives where extremely Sharp and pulled 2 to 4 inch plugs on a fairly damp lawn. Got stuck a couple of times and had to remove sand bags so the mower tires didn't spin on slight hill. Overall worked better than expected. Cleaned up with hose very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Occasional Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Easily Assembled, and Easily Maintained
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid product and relatively easy to assemble with one person (two would be helpful). Excellent instructions and diagrams. Although the manufacturer stresses the need for care around the blades, be doubly careful--they are sharp. Blades can be easily cleaned and sharpened. In the event a blade becomes damaged, the company sells them for $3 plus change each.
customer_reviews.author: Doug L

customer_reviews.title: Missing Hardware
customer_reviews.text: I think this will work well but I needed to purchase several bolts from a local hardware store to put everything together. Very poor quality control. Somehow I got an extra bag of completely useless hardware in the box too.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect homeowner tool
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome for aerating the lawn. Plug spikes work great and really bite in. I used rubber shelf liner so the weighs didn't slide around. I found 100# was just perfect for a 1.5" plug. Assembly is pretty straightforward if you can follow directions. Box weighed 95lbs and UPS didn't beat it up too bad. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Danel

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last
customer_reviews.text: Weld broke on two spike wheels after 6 uses. Not very sturdy for something you pull behind a lawn tractor. Having to repair a new machine has become a regular thing in today’s world. Nothing is made well anymore. Was going to purchase your pull behind spreader as well but think I’ll shop that now
customer_reviews.author: charlie nickel

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my yard and paddocks. Needs the additional weight to work properly but works great with the added weight and not rock hard ground (like we've had with our drought). I believe it really helped my pastures during our drought. My paddocks looked a lot better than my neighbors !!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: ... now and used it several times and it works fine. I find I usually need to put the ...
customer_reviews.text: Had it over a year now and used it several times and it works fine. I find I usually need to put the maximum weight (3 concrete blocks) to get maximum penetration of the tines. From time to time it is necessary to unplug any earth stuck in the tines with a knife or screwdriver. It is quite robust and I have not had any problems when I have gone over tree roots or similar. It did take quite awhile to assemble when I first received it.
customer_reviews.author: ckrug

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Didn't have any issues with missing or bent parts and took about 2-3 hours to put together. You will need to separately buy bungees to keep weighted items on the aerator down such as cinder blocks. Otherwise haven't had any problems, pulls good plugs and hopefully will end up paying for itself in a couple years rather than renting an aerator.
customer_reviews.author: crane_critter

customer_reviews.title: Great value well built for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it once it was assembled. Great for big open yards but not ideal for small yards with lots of turns because it’s hard to get into the curves and corners. The assembly wasn’t bad but took longer than I would have liked. They have you tube instructions but they fly through the assembly and it’s easy to miss something.
customer_reviews.author: Jayson Bates

customer_reviews.title: Good aerator
customer_reviews.text: I have very hard packed clay soil and I found this to work really good. Created holes about 1/2 inch deep using 50lbs of weight. Next time I might add another 50 to go a little deeper. I did have to make 2 passes over each area to get the desired coverage, not a big deal to me. I only take off 1 star do to the notch design that holds the lifting handle. Slips out easily unless you take your time to seat it firmly. May adjust that with a grinder in the Spring.
customer_reviews.author: S G

customer_reviews.title: Missing hardware and Ambiguous Instructions
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for an aerator with ambiguous instructions and missing pieces, look no further, you’ve found it! Whether it’s deformed bolts or broken bolts, this box has them all! If you’re looking for bolt sized millimeters in difference not clearly defined in the instructions, you’ve found it! If you don’t have a shop with extra bolts, nuts, and washers, don’t buy this! One more thing, they don’t even provide grease for the wheel hubs or the blades.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M.

customer_reviews.title: the knifes are sharp
customer_reviews.text: WEAR PROTECTIVE GLOVES the knifes are sharp when assembling , and don't move with weight on the tray. it's not balanced correctly with the weight and the tongue will raise quickly and the knife would move forward, the knifes will cut your leg. It work great with the weight, and got my yard done quickly. Ready for spring lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Gab

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working well for our land.
customer_reviews.text: It works. The assembly instructions are ok. The Orange sheet metal weight shelf flexes more than I'd like. I may modify by reinforcing it because it needs weight like cinder blocks on to to punch holes in clay.
customer_reviews.author: A&JFarm

customer_reviews.title: it works!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fact it has solid tires. I know it will be ready for use no matter how long it sits around unlike pneumatic tired versions. It is well built and should last. I use it after a rain when the ground is softer with a couple of cement blocks strapped in the weight pan and it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Informed Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Hesitated on buying this as most of this stuff breaks easily and not worth the money, however, I was pleasantly surprised and it worked great. Best used on flat surface but if you secure the bricks, its fine. Pulls out lawn plugs and looks like a professional did the job. Definitely worth the money and would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product,  great service.
customer_reviews.text: I am well pleased with my airator, had to put it together and it was a breeze. Called the Co. about a small issue, and they were very professional and promptly handle my issue. The product was not made of flimsy materials, but is intact made of high quality material. All in all I would by my next piece of equipment from Agri-Fab.
customer_reviews.author: Barrett Wayne Mccaine

customer_reviews.title: Worth having around.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re a DIY like myself this is worth having. I won’t comment on durability as I just got it. I was fortunate enough that all pieces were in the box & it was put together easily enough. Put it to use immediately and am happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Richey

customer_reviews.title: OK for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very poor assembly instructions. Takes a long time to assemble. "Flat free tires" mean that they are solid plastic. I would rather have the semi-pneumatic tires. Transport handle does not stay locked when you go over a bump while transporting. For the money it is ok but I would probably purchase the John Deere instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good product with some design obstacles
customer_reviews.text: Overall the product is good. The instructions could use some tightening up - big bag of bolts, washers - that are just marginally unique make the assembly harder than necessary. The handle to shift the product into open drive mode rather than aerate mow is poorly designed. There is supposed to be an offset or detente that holds the handle into open drive mode - but to make it work correctly - you have the shove and push the unit during assembly to get it to adjust. There ought to be a better way. I found a workaround - but wish I didnt have to . WIthout the handle issue - I would give 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Sas

customer_reviews.title: More of a hybrid spike/core aerator than a true core aerator.
customer_reviews.text: It's more of a hybrid spike/core aerator than a true core aerator. Plugs are small and shallow, and it would not core hard soil with 100# on board even after several days with rain. The only reason I'm keeping it is because I can use it several times a year whenever it is convenient for me. For comparison I've included a picture of what a typical core aeration should look like.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Philips

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty well made. A pain, literally, to assemble. Wear gloves when assembling the blades, else you’ll end up looking Iike Edward Scissorhands. Follow the directions carefully. Also, to get the best performance aerate after a good rain and place 120-140pounds of weight on the tray. I used salt bags and strapped in place with bungee cords.
customer_reviews.author: VVV

customer_reviews.title: Areator
customer_reviews.text: Very well built unit. Thick metal parts. I actually had all the hardware (bolts) needed to assemble. Some reviews stated not having enough bolts. The only negative is in the transport position the latch will not stay up in (transport ) position. I have to reach back and keep my hand on the lever when crossing concrete or other areas I don't want to areate. It works well...Pulled out good size plugs which its designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Gay

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA and it shows
customer_reviews.text: High quality and good value. All parts with the assembly. Have used several times without a problem and have concrete block weights to ensure better depth of plugs. Assembly was timely but I have an electric wrench so the process is quite quick and instructions were clear enough and written in English!. All in all good value. Made in USA of real steel.
customer_reviews.author: bigXman

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: You cannot get the tines to get clearance while driving on surfaces you don't want to aeration. No matter what you do they drag!
customer_reviews.author: James delaney

customer_reviews.title: good product gets better with experience
customer_reviews.text: Plugs are a bit shallow, but it seems to work well otherwise. The plugs fall free easily and do not clog the cutters, even in our east Texas gumbo soil. It might take some trial and error to get good results if you've never used one of these before. It is important to pull it really slow. You will need to put a few concrete blocks on it to get the cutters to sink into the ground well. You need to be mindful that the soil is not too wet (just makes a mess) or too dry (rides on top and does not cut plugs). I usually wait and do this about two days after a good hard rain.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Wear gloves !
customer_reviews.text: Just finished putting this together everything was well packaged no missing parts do yourself a favor put the tines on last a lot easier wear heavy gloves they are razor sharp about 11/2 hrs to put together with hand tools would be a lot easier with an air ratchet waiting for rain to come to soften my yard up well made in the USA 🇺🇸
customer_reviews.author: Jamie M. Chlystek

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate steel for areating in new england.
customer_reviews.text: This products steel is inadequate quality. A week after assembly and use the metal tongue that extends to attach to tractor broke and collapsed. Takes about two and a half hours to assemble broke after one week of use. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: mattew Hoseason

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Only issue is the lever for the wheels ...
customer_reviews.text: Now I don't have to rent an aerator! Works great! Only issue is the lever for the wheels does not want to stay in place even after adjusting the tray, but I fixed that with a bungee cord. Great purchase and well made. I recommend wearing gloves when working with this, the cores are pretty sharp and I cut myself on them a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: barnarra

customer_reviews.title: Aerator Review
customer_reviews.text: The base seems a little flimsy as it wobbles a bit when lowering and raising the tines and pushing it around. The hitch is not as tight as I would like. It did the job for the most part except where the soil was very hard.
customer_reviews.author: KCB

customer_reviews.title: It worked great! The soil was moist as we've had a ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased and used it for the first time. It worked great! The soil was moist as we've had a good bit of rain and I was easily pulling 2-3 in plugs. Assembly was easy. Took about 1-2 hours and yes I did have a few cuts at the end. Two nuts were missing. I haven't contacted the company yet to get new ones. A good buy, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. Does a fine job of aeriating the lawn.
customer_reviews.text: Would have rated with 5 stars if the device was easier to handle while not being towed by the lawn tractor. Also, one must be extremely careful when moving the device. the CG is very delicate and the item is being moved by human power. It can tip forward or back very quickly and cause a scrape or cut very quickly. Otherwise, a fine product. C. W. Sheward
customer_reviews.author: Clarence W. Sheward

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Used an air ratchet, made it much easier, lots of hardware for the knives. Worked great though. I aerated and acre, can already see the benefits after a few days. A lot of brown turned green.
customer_reviews.author: otisraccoon

customer_reviews.title: It's a good value for this range.
customer_reviews.text: Missing three bolts and the matching nuts for the missing bolts, at least they were missing together. The top plate is twisted, but works great behind my tractor. I'm using it as a business, it works well I just go slow over hard or uneven ground you would break it if you try to go fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product, I would recommend buying
customer_reviews.text: great product, I would recommend buying, have some extra rags around when putting together to soak up the blood, really I'm surprised others haven't talked about this much. I must had cut myself on the blades about 5 times. I would also recommend putting it on a bench during assembly. Especially with children around to keep it away from them, impaling, and multiple impalings at the same time is a possibility if a a child or anyone falls into or gets pushed into this mid evil contraption lol Seriously great care should be taken.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Carney

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Works better than expected. Extremely happy with the size of plugs this pulls out. The more moisture that is in the ground the deeper the penetration.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Sleight

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Neighbor is jealous. Great buy will pay itself off next season. No reason to let the lawn scare people do it for 200 dollars. Lawn looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This was the second of two aerators I bought in the past week. I did not use or assemble the other aerator. I’ll return it today. This aerator required assembly. The directions were easy to follow along with very good illustrations. It took me closer to 3 hours to assemble. There were 3 hex bolts that were the wrong size. I bought the size I needed from Home Depot. The product did an outstanding job aerating my lawn!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't bad putting it together ,looks like a quality aerator.I did buy 4 block to strap on top to give it alittle more weight.We had a lot of snow this winter so my yard needed a good aeration this spring.It worked awesome and pulled very nice behind my zero turn mower.Id recommend purchasing this aerator over renting a smaller walk behind each year.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Karch

customer_reviews.title: Quality USA product!
customer_reviews.text: Cost more than the imported ones, seems to be built very well. I didn't do a side by side comparison with other brands but I feel this a quality item that should last
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: The price was great and it paid for itself in one use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on the "prime day" sale. The price was great and it paid for itself in one use. (My lawn care service provider wants close to $300 to aerate my one acre lot.) Wasn't too hard to put together. I wish the spikes went a little deeper into the soil... it seemed to only be getting about a 1.5 inch plug on average. That's with 140 lbs of sand as added weight about two days after a decent rain. Maybe more weight will help??
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: I have about 30,000 square feet of hilly/difficult lawn and so far it has held up through the first use. Seems pretty sturdy and produces good plugs (only after a rain) . If I can get 3 more uses out of it I would be happy. If you have flat relatively easy terrain it should last a long time. The directions are horrible!
customer_reviews.author: A. Battle

customer_reviews.title: Take your time with assembly and wear leather work gloves. The plug knives are razor sharp.
customer_reviews.text: The product is a winner. It is a strong product. Assembly takes a little time. Patience during the assembly process will help avoid cuts and nicks.. Leather work gloves are strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: South Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Works great & very reasonably priced. Really like the wheels. My previous model had rubber tires that were always in need of air. It's a little difficult to raise up especially when fully loaded with concrete blocks but I'll get that worked out. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Aerator is easy to assemble and operate
customer_reviews.text: This product met all my needs. The assembly was easy. Operating the unit is simple. I added 120 lbs. of tractor weights to get the amount of soil penetration needed. It cut perfect cores. I overlapped the passes as recommended and got the aeration pattern I was looking for. Only buy this unit if you have a lot of yard to cover. 48" is a significantly wide swath to make in tight quarters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in a open and badly damaged box, with the main shift bent, hitch missing, and short 4, 3/8 ×1 short. I had hoped to have the product assembled and put to use this past weekend. No luck, my next opertunity is 3 weeks from now assuming I get the parts I need
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. A ton of pieces so took me ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. A ton of pieces so took me about 2 hours to put together but not particularly difficult. The only reason I dropped a star is when it arrived the package was nearly destroyed. I was amazed not part were missing or were damaged. Used it once this fall and it was perfect. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: normalguy

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Hardware pack I Received did not have all the necessary parts to assemble. I have to contact agra fab and probably wait two weeks to get a couple of spacers.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control & lazy shipping co
customer_reviews.text: I waited 1 1/2 wks for my ago fab aerator it came & box was torn a shaft was sticking out of it & only 1/3 of parts were in box & I could not put aerator together.I can not believe a manufacturer could have dasity to ship a product to a customer with only 1/3 of parts an a beat box.Now I’m going to have to rent an aerator because parts will take 2-3 wks to get. Dave Maeder
customer_reviews.author: Dave maeder

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: It was a 2+ hour project to put this toll together, but it performs very well. The lawn is a bit dry right now, so the plugs are short. I plan on trying again after it rains tomorrow since you are supposed to core it in both directions for best results.
customer_reviews.author: mark dorn

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are bad and the package was missing some screws. It took awhile to put together and is sometimee difficult from spikes. Once I got it together it does work but the top part where you put weights is too short, they kept bouncing off.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Pustay II

customer_reviews.title: Quality product. Thought maybe we could use this to ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality product. Thought maybe we could use this to help control gophers as well as help the soil. It helped the soil OK but think it made it easier for the gophers to dig their tunnels by loosening the soil.
customer_reviews.author: HappyCamper

customer_reviews.title: Missing peices ,not bolts but essential peices
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it will work good but cant tell, because its missing parts and judging by the paperwork taped up box and customer service, it happens a lot. Now i have parts all over that will probably get lost while waiting for the missing parts to be sent in the mail. So annoying! But overall it looks pretty sweet and durable, if i ever get all the peices it might just do the job.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great equipment
customer_reviews.text: This was absolutely a great piece of equipment. Easy to put together and worked like a charm behind our John Deere lawn mower.. would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KRLARAMO

product_meta.title: Agri-Fab 45-0299 48-Inch Tow Plug Aerator,Orange & Black,Large
product_meta.description:
The Agri-Fab, 48” Plug Aerator Tow Behind Lawn Groomer Model #45-0299 will have your lawn looking better in no time. The 48” Plug Aerator will loosen the compacted soil in your yard. It will pull 3” plugs of soil out to allow necessary air, water, and nutrients to penetrate your lawns roots. This will allow your lawn to grow strong and healthy, giving your lawn that professionally groomed look that you have been wanting. The 48” plug aerator has a weight tray that can hold up to 140 lbs. for added soil penetration. There are 32 self-sharpening plug aerator knives on the unit. The flat free tires allow for smooth transportation and require less maintenance. The transport handle can be reached from the seat of the tractor and allows for easy raising and lowering of the plug aerator. With its universal hitch, the plug aerator can be hooked up to any tractor. The Agri-Fab, 48” Plug Aerator Tow Behind Lawn Groomer Model #45-0299 will last you for years to come with proper care and use. All Agri-Fab, products come with a 3-year limited .

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Healthy lawns need tough love, and Agri-Fab has the lawn grooming tools to tackle the job. The 48" plug aerator will loosen the soil to allow air, water and nutrients to reach your lawn's root system. Agri-Fab plug aerators aerate up to 3" deep for a healthier lawn.
feature_bullets: 32 galvanized knives to penetrate the soil easily.
Pulls plugs up to 3 inches deep for thicker and healthier lawn.
Flat free tires for smooth transport.
Simple-to-use cantilever transport handle for easy raising and lowering.
3 Year Limited Consumer Warranty; Made in the USA with some imported materials

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars692 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
